item.title: 中日领导人一年来首次面对面会谈
item.description:
Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida and Chinese President Xi Jinping held their first face-to-face talks in a year on the sidelines of the APEC summit in San Francisco on Thursday evening.翻译:日本首相岸田文雄和中国国家主席习近平周四晚上在旧金山举行的亚太经合组织峰会期间举行了一年来的首次面对面会谈。

The two leaders are expected to discuss the creation of a new dialogue framework on trade issues and seek to broadly put relations on a sounder footing after a series of disputes.翻译:预计两国领导人将讨论建立一个关于贸易问题的新对话框架，并寻求在一系列争端后广泛建立更健全的关系。

"Japan and China coexist and prosper as neighbors and have a responsibility to contribute to world peace and prosperity," Kishida told Xi at the start of their talks, as they sat across from one another at a table flanked by their delegations.翻译:“日本和中国作为邻国共存繁荣，有责任为世界和平与繁荣做出贡献，”岸田在会谈开始时告诉习近平。当时，岸田与两国代表团面对面坐在一张桌子旁。

Relations between the neighbours have been upset most recently by China's ban on Japanese seafood following Tokyo's decision to release treated water from its crippled Fukushima nuclear plant into the sea in August.翻译:最近，东京决定将受损的福岛核电站处理后的水排入大海后，中国对日本海鲜实施禁令，这使邻国之间的关系受到了影响。

Kishida plans to call for the reversal of China's ban and will also insist on the early release of Japanese nationals arrested by Chinese authorities, while global issues like the conflict in Gaza are also expected to be on the agenda, Japanese media reported.翻译:据日本媒体报道，岸田计划呼吁中国撤销禁令，并坚持要求早日释放被中国当局逮捕的日本公民，而加沙冲突等全球问题预计也将提上议程。

"There are many issues and concerns between Japan and China," Japan’s Chief Cabinet Secretary Hirokazu Matsuno told a news conference in Tokyo shortly before the meeting.翻译:“日本和中国之间存在许多问题和担忧，”日本内阁官房长官松野博和在会议前不久在东京举行的新闻发布会上表示。

"But Japan's consistent policy is to assert what needs to be asserted ... and to cooperate on common issues, and to build constructive and stable relations."翻译:“但日本的一贯政策是主张需要主张的东西……并在共同问题上进行合作，并建立建设性和稳定的关系。”

The meeting follows a highly-anticipated summit between U.S. President Joe Biden and Xi on Wednesday in which the two superpowers agreed to open a presidential hotline and resume military-to-military communications, among other matters.翻译:此次会议之前，美国总统乔·拜登和习近平周三举行了备受期待的峰会，其中两个超级大国同意开通总统热线并恢复军队之间的沟通等事项。

On the sidelines of the APEC summit, Kishida has also met South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol in their seventh meeting this year as relations between the historic rivals warm. The pair promised to push for deeper cooperation and discussed shared concerns like North Korea's missile tests.翻译:在亚太经合组织峰会期间，岸田还与韩国总统尹锡烈会面，这是他们今年第七次会面，这两个历史对手之间的关系正在升温。两人承诺推动更深层次的合作，并讨论了朝鲜导弹试验等共同关心的问题。

Yoon, Kishida and Biden are due to hold a trilateral meeting later on Thursday, according to Yoon's office.翻译:据尹办公室称，尹、岸田和拜登定于周四晚些时候举行三边会议。

Leaders from the 21-member Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation forum are in San Francisco for the 30th summit from Nov. 15-17.翻译:亚太经合组织21个成员国的领导人将于11月15日至17日在旧金山举行第30届峰会。

Reporting by Mariko Katsumura, John Geddie, Kaori Kaneko and Sakura Murakami in Tokyo; Editing by Deepa Babington and Stephen Coates翻译:Mariko Katsumura、John Geddie、Kaori Kaneko 和 Sakura Murakami 在东京的报道；迪帕·巴宾顿和斯蒂芬·科茨编辑

item.title: 中缅边境地区发生5.7级地震 - GFZ
item.description:
An earthquake of magnitude 5.7 struck the Myanmar-China border region on Friday, German Research Centre for Geosciences (GFZ) said.翻译:德国地球科学研究中心（GFZ）表示，周五，中缅边境地区发生了 5.7 级地震。

item.title: 拜登在亚太经合组织上宣扬工人权利和稳定的中国关系
item.description:
U.S. President Joe Biden on Thursday said he would keep working to advance a Pacific trade pact, even as his vision for a regional deal to counter China's influence stumbled over his bid to strengthen workers' rights.翻译:美国总统乔·拜登周四表示，他将继续努力推进太平洋贸易协定，尽管他关于达成一项旨在对抗中国影响力的区域协议的愿景因加强工人权利的努力而受挫。

"Our work is not yet done," Biden told corporate CEOs in San Francisco where he attended a summit of the 21-member Asia Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) forum.翻译:“我们的工作尚未完成，”拜登在旧金山出席由 21 个成员国组成的亚太经济合作组织 (APEC) 论坛峰会时对企业首席执行官说道。

"We will continue working to better facilitate high-standard trade that advances workers' rights through strong enforcement of labor standards."翻译:“我们将继续努力更好地促进高标准贸易，通过强有力地执行劳工标准来促进工人的权利。”

Biden was also to take part on Thursday in an event for the Indo-Pacific Economic Framework (IPEF), a 14-nation group his administration established.翻译:拜登还将于周四参加印度太平洋经济框架 (IPEF) 的活动，该框架是他的政府成立的一个由 14 个国家组成的组织。

Hopes for an IPEF trade deal were dashed this week. Members could not agree on improving labor and environmental standards or compliance, people briefed on the talks said.翻译:IPEF 贸易协议的希望本周破灭了。了解会谈情况的人士表示，成员们未能就改善劳工和环境标准或合规性达成一致。

The U.S. and its Indo-Pacific partners need to regroup and "recalibrate" their trade pillar negotiations early next year, Deputy U.S. Trade Representative Sarah Bianchi told Reuters on Thursday.翻译:美国副贸易代表莎拉·比安奇周四对路透社表示，美国及其印太伙伴需要在明年初重新组合并“重新调整”其贸易支柱谈判。

Asked how long an IPEF trade agreement could take to conclude, an administration official said most negotiations take years but the White House intended to work on an "accelerated timeline."翻译:当被问及 IPEF 贸易协议需要多长时间才能达成时，一名政府官员表示，大多数谈判需要数年时间，但白宫打算“加快时间表”。

The White House started the IPEF to bolster economic engagement with Asia after former President Donald Trump quit a regional trade pact in 2017. Biden, a Democrat, could face Republican Trump again in next year's presidential election, a face-off that could impact U.S. support of multi-lateral groups like APEC or the IMF and trade policy.翻译:在前总统唐纳德·特朗普于 2017 年退出区域贸易协定后，白宫启动了 IPEF，以加强与亚洲的经济接触。民主党人拜登可能会在明年的总统选举中再次面对共和党人特朗普，这场对峙可能会影响美国的支持亚太经合组织或国际货币基金组织等多边组织和贸易政策。

After a day of meetings, Biden said the leaders signed a supply chain agreement to identify bottlenecks before issues occur, such as during the height of the COVID pandemic. He also said they concluded agreements to accelerate clean energy transitions, as well as an agreement to combat corruption.翻译:经过一天的会议后，拜登表示，两国领导人签署了一项供应链协议，以便在问题发生之前（例如在新冠疫情最严重的时候）发现瓶颈。他还表示，他们达成了加速清洁能源转型的协议，以及打击腐败的协议。

He also touted the launch of an "investment accelerator" to bring in private capital for investments in clean energy and technology.翻译:他还宣传推出“投资加速器”，以引入私人资本投资清洁能源和技术。

"Government investment is not enough," he said. "We need to mobilize private investment."

U.S. INVESTMENT IN ASIA

Before the APEC summit, Biden on Thursday touted investments by U.S. companies in the region including Amazon.com (AMZN.O), Delta Air Lines (DAL.N), PepsiCo (PEP.O), Apple (AAPL.O) and Boeing. (BA.N)翻译:在APEC峰会之前，拜登周四宣扬美国公司在该地区的投资，包括亚马逊(AMZN.O) 、达美航空(DAL.N) 、百事可乐(PEP.O) 、苹果(AAPL.O)和波音。 （禁止）

He argued that continued U.S. economic growth would buoy the entire world, an assessment challenged by the sluggish global economy.翻译:他认为，美国经济的持续增长将提振整个世界，但这一评估受到全球经济低迷的挑战。

The International Monetary Fund last month cut its growth forecasts for China and said overall global growth remained low and uneven despite what it called the "remarkable strength" of the U.S. economy. It projects 3.0% real global GDP growth for 2023.翻译:国际货币基金组织上个月下调了对中国的增长预测，并表示，尽管美国经济“强劲”，但全球总体增长仍然较低且不平衡。预计 2023 年全球 GDP 实际增长率为 3.0%。

Biden said 60% of U.S. exports went to APEC countries, and American businesses were the largest source foreign direct investment in those economies, committing at least $40 billion in 2023.翻译:拜登表示，美国60%的出口流向APEC国家，美国企业是这些经济体最大的外国直接投资来源，承诺到2023年投资至少400亿美元。

U.S. Commerce Secretary Gina Raimondo said earlier on Thursday IPEF countries had agreed on several "pillars" of the trade initiative, covering cooperation on clean energy and anti-corruption measures. Ministers also formally signed a previously agreed text of a third pillar, covering supply chain resiliency.翻译:美国商务部长吉娜·雷蒙多周四早些时候表示， IPEF 成员国已就贸易倡议的几个“支柱”达成一致，其中包括清洁能源合作和反腐败措施。部长们还正式签署了先前商定的第三支柱文本，涵盖供应链弹性。

The U.S.-backed initiative is not the only game in town. Trade ministers from the Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership countries on Wednesday welcomed more members to the bloc if they can meet its standards.翻译:美国支持的倡议并不是唯一的游戏。跨太平洋伙伴关系全面进步协定国家的贸易部长周三欢迎更多能够达到其标准的成员国加入该集团。

An earlier version of that trade bloc was abandoned by Trump, and under Biden, free-trade deals have been placed on the back burner amid pressure from labor groups.翻译:该贸易集团的早期版本已被特朗普放弃，而在拜登的领导下，在劳工团体的压力下，自由贸易协议已被搁置。

APEC members have been closely watching developments between the U.S. and China, the world's two largest economies and strategic rivals, concerned that ever more intense competition could upset global trade and security.翻译:亚太经合组织成员一直密切关注美国和中国这两个世界最大经济体和战略竞争对手之间的事态发展，担心日益激烈的竞争可能会扰乱全球贸易和安全。

Biden, who held a high-stakes summit with Chinese President Xi Jinping on Wednesday aimed at steadying tense relations, said a stable relationship between the U.S. and China was good for the world.翻译:拜登周三与中国国家主席习近平举行了旨在稳定紧张关系的高风险峰会，他表示，美国和中国之间稳定的关系对世界有利。

He said he told Xi that he regarded the United States as "a Pacific nation" that will remain engaged in the region. Biden said the United States was not de-coupling its economy from China, but "de-risking and diversifying."翻译:他说，他告诉习近平，他认为美国是一个“太平洋国家”，将继续参与该地区事务。拜登表示，美国并不是要使其经济与中国脱钩，而是“去风险化和多元化”。

"A stable relationship between the world's two largest economies is not merely good for those two economies but for the world," Biden said to applause. "It's good for everyone."翻译:“世界最大的两个经济体之间的稳定关系不仅有利于这两个经济体，也有利于世界，”拜登在掌声中说道。 “这对每个人都有好处。”

Reporting by Trevor Hunnicutt, David Brunnstrom, Nandita Bose, Katharine Jackson, Andrea Shalal and Doina Chiacu; Editing by Cynthia Osterman and Stephen Coates翻译:Trevor Hunnicutt、David Brunnstrom、Nandita Bose、Katharine Jackson、Andrea Shalal 和 Doina Chiacu 报道；辛西娅·奥斯特曼和斯蒂芬·科茨编辑

item.title: 云业务分拆搁置后阿里巴巴港股下跌8%
item.description:
Hong Kong-listed shares of Alibaba Group (9988.HK) slumped 8% on Friday after it scrapped plans to spin off its cloud business, citing uncertainties over U.S. restrictions on chips used in artificial intelligence applications.翻译:周五，阿里巴巴集团（9988.HK）在香港上市的股价下跌 8%，此前该公司放弃了剥离云业务的计划，理由是美国对人工智能应用芯片的限制存在不确定性。

The stock fell to as low as HK$75.0, down 7.8%, in opening trade, the first reaction in Asia since the announcement late on Thursday. The company's U.S. listed securities closed down 9%.翻译:该股开盘跌至 75.0 港元，跌幅为 7.8%，这是自周四晚间宣布这一消息以来亚洲的第一反应。该公司在美国上市的证券收盘下跌 9%。

Alibaba, once Asia's most valuable stock, was worth around $830 billion at its peak in October 2020 but is now valued at less than one fourth, as the e-commerce giant took centre-stage in Beijing's technology sector crackdown and as the Chinese economy slowed.翻译:阿里巴巴曾经是亚洲最有价值的股票，在 2020 年 10 月的巅峰时期市值约为 8,300 亿美元，但随着这家电子商务巨头在北京科技行业打击行动中占据中心地位以及中国经济放缓，目前估值不到四分之一。

Alibaba's concerns over U.S. export curbs come on the heels of similar worries raised this week by Chinese tech giant Tencent Holdings (0700.HK) which said the restrictions would force it to seek domestically produced alternatives.翻译:阿里巴巴对美国出口限制的担忧紧随中国科技巨头腾讯控股（0700.HK）本周提出的类似担忧之后，腾讯控股表示，这些限制将迫使其寻求国内生产的替代品。

The news underscores broader hurdles facing China's big tech companies as the U.S. export curbs makes it harder for them to get crucial chip supplies from U.S. companies.翻译:这一消息凸显了中国大型科技公司面临的更广泛障碍，因为美国的出口限制使它们更难从美国公司获得关键的芯片供应。

In March, Alibaba announced plans to carve out the cloud business as part of the biggest restructuring in its 24-year history.翻译:今年 3 月，阿里巴巴宣布计划剥离云业务，作为其 24 年历史上最大的重组的一部分。

Analysts had in March estimated the cloud division could be worth $41-$60 billion but had warned that its listing could attract scrutiny from both Chinese and overseas regulators due to the reams of data it manages.翻译:分析师在 3 月份曾估计该云部门的价值可能为 41 至 600 亿美元，但警告称，由于其管理的大量数据，其上市可能会引起中国和海外监管机构的审查。

The Hangzhou-based company, in announcing its quarterly earnings on Thursday, also put on hold a listing plan for its groceries business Freshippo.翻译:这家总部位于杭州的公司在周四公布季度收益时，还搁置了其食品杂货业务盒马鲜生的上市计划。

Alibaba reported second-quarter revenue of 224.79 billion yuan ($31.01 billion), in line with the 224.32 billion expected by analysts, LSEG data showed.翻译:伦敦证券交易所数据显示，阿里巴巴第二季度营收为人民币 2,247.9 亿元（合 310.1 亿美元），与分析师预期的 2,243.2 亿元一致。

Eddie Wu, chief executive of Alibaba, on an earnings call detailed the company's future strategy, saying that each of its businesses would face the market more independently and that they would conduct a strategic review to distinguish between "core" and "non-core" businesses.翻译:阿里巴巴首席执行官埃迪·吴(Eddie Wu)在财报电话会议上详细介绍了公司的未来战略，称其各项业务将更加独立地面对市场，并将进行战略审查，以区分“核心”和“非核心”企业。

item.title: 由于收益率和石油下跌，亚洲股市保持每周涨幅
item.description:
Summary:
  • Asian stock markets :
  • Asia stocks ex-Japan head for best week since July
  • Oil prices near four-month low after steep sell off
  • Bonds rally as softer U.S. data hardens rate cut bets
翻译:概括：
  • 亚洲股市：
  • 除日本外亚洲股市创 7 月以来最佳单周表现
  • 油价在大幅抛售后接近四个月低点
  • 美国数据疲软强化降息押注，债券上涨

Asian shares took a breather on Friday as a batch of softer U.S. economic data took some of the steam out of Wall Street, but also boosted bonds in a big way while slugging oil prices in a boon for the inflation outlook.翻译:周五，亚洲股市稍作喘息，因为一系列疲软的美国经济数据让华尔街失去了一些动力，但也大幅提振了债券价格，同时打压油价，有利于通胀前景。

MSCI's broadest index of Asia-Pacific shares outside Japan (.MIAPJ0000PUS) eased 0.4% from a two-month high, but still up 3.1% so far for the week in its best performance since July.翻译:MSCI 日本以外最广泛的亚太股市指数(.MIAPJ0000PUS)从两个月高点下跌 0.4%，但本周迄今仍上涨 3.1%，为 7 月以来的最佳表现。

Both Brent and U.S. crude slid almost 5% on Thursday to four-month lows in a move that was blamed on economic and supply concerns, though technical selling likely played a part when the $80 bulwark broke.翻译:布伦特原油和美国原油周四均下跌近 5%，跌至四个月低点，此举被归咎于经济和供应担忧，尽管 80 美元堡垒破裂时技术性抛售可能发挥了作用。

Dealers suspected algorithmic and trend-following funds drove the speculative sell off with much of the losses coming in just a single hour of trade.翻译:交易商怀疑算法和趋势跟踪基金推动了投机性抛售，大部分损失发生在短短一个小时的交易时间内。

Brent was last down 10 cents at $77.36 a barrel, and a world away from the $97.69 top hit in late September, while U.S. crude eased 7 cents to $72.83.翻译:布伦特原油价格最后下跌 10 美分，至每桶 77.36 美元，与 9 月底触及的 97.69 美元高点相去甚远，而美国原油则下跌 7 美分，至每桶 72.83 美元。

Whatever the cause, the rout should put added downward pressure on consumer prices across the globe and reinforce expectations of policy easing next year.翻译:无论原因是什么，这场暴跌都应该给全球消费者价格带来更大的下行压力，并强化明年政策宽松的预期。

Adding to the disinflationary theme was commentary from Walmart (WMT.N) executives that costs were "more in check" and they were planning on cutting prices for the holiday season.翻译:沃尔玛（WMT.N）高管评论称，成本“得到了更多控制”，并且他们计划在假期期间降价，这进一步加剧了通货紧缩的主题。

Equity investors were not as impressed with the idea of margin compression and knocked Walmart shares down 8%, while a drop in energy stocks dragged on the S&P 500.翻译:股票投资者对利润压缩的想法并不感兴趣，导致沃尔玛股价下跌 8%，而能源股的下跌也拖累了标准普尔 500 指数。

Early Friday, S&P 500 futures were all but flat, as were Nasdaq futures . EUROSTOXX 50 futures gained 0.3% and FTSE futures 0.2%.翻译:周五早些时候，标准普尔 500 指数期货几乎持平，纳斯达克指数期货也是如此。欧洲斯托克 50 指数期货上涨 0.3%，富时指数期货上涨 0.2%。

Japan's Nikkei (.N225) added 0.2%, to be 2.8% firmer for the week, helped by reassurance from the Bank of Japan that it was sticking with its super loose policy.翻译:日本日经指数(.N225)上涨 0.2%，本周上涨 2.8%，这得益于日本央行保证将坚持其超级宽松政策。

Chinese blue chips (.CSI300) were a fraction lower, having missed on the general rally so far this week.翻译:中国蓝筹股（.CSI300）小幅下跌，错过了本周迄今为止的总体反弹。

Sentiment in Asia was supported by the apparent easing of tensions between the United States and China, with the Chinese press lauding the meeting between President Xi Jinping and President Joe Biden.翻译:亚洲的情绪受到美国和中国之间紧张局势明显缓和的支撑，中国媒体称赞习近平主席和乔·拜登总统之间的会晤。

Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida was also set to hold talk with Xi at the APEC summit.

COUNTING ON CUTS

Bond markets were still cheering this week's benign U.S. inflation report, with futures now pricing in almost zero chance of another rate hike from the Federal Reserve and a 34% probability it might ease as early as March.翻译:债券市场仍在为本周良性的美国通胀报告欢呼，目前期货定价美联储再次加息的可能性几乎为零，而最早在 3 月份放宽利率的可能性为 34%。

The market is pricing in 98 basis points of cuts next year, compared with 73 basis points a week ago.翻译:市场预计明年将降息 98 个基点，而一周前为 73 个基点。

"With labor market activity slowing and further disinflation expected, we see the Fed on hold before starting to lower rates in the second half of 2024 to avoid a recession," wrote analysts at JPMorgan in a note.翻译:摩根大通分析师在一份报告中写道：“随着劳动力市场活动放缓和预期进一步通货紧缩，我们预计美联储将按兵不动，然后在 2024 年下半年开始降息以避免经济衰退。”

"We forecast the policy rate to drop 100 basis points in 2H24 to end the year at 4.5%, before settling on hold at 3.5% by 1Q25."翻译:“我们预计政策利率将在 2024 年下半年下降 100 个基点，年底达到 4.5%，然后在 2025 年第一季度保持在 3.5%。”

Treasury investors were looking to price in a little of that right now with yields on two-year treasuries down a whopping 21 basis points for the week at 4.85%. That was their best weekly performance since March.翻译:国债投资者目前希望消化其中的一点点，两年期国债收益率本周大幅下跌 21 个基点，至 4.85%。这是他们自三月份以来最好的每周表现。

Ten-year note yields stood at 4.44%, having fallen 18 basis points for the week so far, a rousing rally from the 5.02% high hit just a month ago.翻译:十年期国债收益率为 4.44%，本周迄今已下跌 18 个基点，较一个月前触及的 5.02% 高点出现令人振奋的反弹。

The sea change in market pricing for the Fed has left the dollar looking soggy, with the euro up at $1.0853 and holding gains of 1.6% for the week so far.翻译:美联储市场定价的巨大变化使得美元看起来疲软，欧元兑美元汇率上涨至1.0853美元，本周迄今为止涨幅为1.6%。

The dollar even lost ground to the yen, easing to 150.67 yen and away from a 151.92 peak hit early in the week. It fared better against commodity-linked currencies such as the Canadian dollar , which were hampered by the slide in oil.翻译:美元兑日元汇率甚至下跌，跌至 150.67 日元，远离本周初触及的 151.92 日元峰值。它兑加元等大宗商品相关货币的表现较好，而加元则受到石油下滑的阻碍。

The drop in bond yields proved bullish for gold, which nudged up to $1,982 an ounce .翻译:债券收益率的下降对黄金有利，金价升至每盎司 1,982 美元。

Reporting by Wayne Cole; Editing by Sam Holmes翻译:韦恩·科尔报道；山姆·霍姆斯编辑

item.title: 自由港首席执行官：中美关系解冻迹象“受到鼓舞”
item.description:
Freeport-McMoRan Inc (FCX.N) Chief Executive Richard Adkerson said on Thursday he is "encouraged" by signs of improving relations between the world's two biggest economies, including the talks held this week between U.S. President Joe Biden and Chinese President Xi Jinping.翻译:自由港麦克莫兰公司 (FCX.N) 首席执行官理查德·阿德克森 (Richard Adkerson) 周四表示，他对世界两大经济体之间关系改善的迹象感到“鼓舞”，其中包括美国总统乔·拜登和中国国家主席习近平本周举行的会谈。

"The world would be a better place if there is a reasonable relationship between China and the United States," Adkerson said on the sidelines of the Asia Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) forum in San Francisco.翻译:阿德克森在旧金山举行的亚太经合组织（APEC）论坛间隙表示：“如果中美之间存在合理的关系，世界将会变得更加美好。”

"We have to wait and see whether it's a watershed moment or not," he said, adding that the issues dividing the two countries are significant.翻译:他说：“我们必须拭目以待，看看这是否是一个分水岭。”他补充说，两国之间的分歧问题很严重。

"This is not a situation where there's going to be a magic wand to deal with all of the matters of concern between the two countries."翻译:“这并不是一种神奇的魔杖可以解决两国之间所有关心的问题。”

Freeport is the world's largest publicly traded copper producer, with operations across North and South America. China is the world's biggest consumer of copper.翻译:自由港是世界上最大的公开交易的铜生产商，业务遍及北美和南美。中国是全球最大的铜消费国。

The company also operates the Grasberg mine in Indonesia, which is the world's largest gold mine and second-largest copper mine.翻译:该公司还经营印度尼西亚的格拉斯伯格矿，这是世界上最大的金矿和第二大铜矿。

Though a much smaller economy than China, Indonesia's place in the world is of growing importance, Adkerson said, though "over the years, the appreciation of the strategic importance of Indonesia within the U.S has not been adequate."翻译:阿德克森表示，尽管印尼的经济规模比中国小得多，但其在世界上的地位却日益重要，尽管“多年来，美国对印尼的战略重要性的认识还不够充分”。

One sign that this appreciation is beginning to change was Biden's meeting at the start of this week in Washington with Indonesian President Joko Widodo as part of preparations for the APEC summit, Adkerson said.翻译:阿德克森表示， 拜登本周初在华盛顿与印度尼西亚总统佐科维多多会面，这是亚太经合组织峰会筹备工作的一部分，这表明这种看法开始发生变化。

"All reports are that was an excellent meeting, despite the issues of the Mideast, that are very important and challenging," he said.翻译:他说：“所有报道都表明，这是一次出色的会议，尽管中东问题非常重要且具有挑战性。”

Jokowi, as the president is popularly known, at that meeting pressed Biden to do more to stop Israel's bombing of Gaza.翻译:总统佐科威在那次会议上敦促拜登采取更多措施阻止以色列轰炸加沙。

"Indonesia I know wants to have good relationships with the U.S., they want good relationships with China," said Adkerson. "The U.S. needs to give attention, consideration and support for countries like Indonesia, and we'll be better off for it."翻译:“我知道印度尼西亚希望与美国建立良好的关系，他们希望与中国建立良好的关系，”阿德克森说。 “美国需要对印尼这样的国家给予关注、考虑和支持，我们会因此而变得更好。”

Reporting by Ann Saphir; Editing by Stephen Coates翻译:安·萨菲尔报道；斯蒂芬·科茨编辑

item.title: 菲律宾马科斯与中国习近平讨论南海紧张局势及未来发展方向
item.description:
Philippines President Ferdinand Marcos Jr said on Friday he will meet with his Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping at the sidelines of the APEC Summit in San Francisco翻译:APEC峰会在旧金山举行 to discuss tensions and formulate ways forward in the South China Sea.

"We will get the view of the Chinese president on what we can do to bring down the temperature, to not escalate the situation in the West Philippine Sea," Marcos said in a video message.翻译:马科斯在视频消息中说：“我们将听取中国国家主席的意见，了解我们可以采取哪些措施来降低气温，避免西菲律宾海局势升级。”

Manila refers to the part of the South China Sea that it claims as the West Philippine Sea.翻译:马尼拉将其声称拥有主权的南海部分称为西菲律宾海。

"We will put together the ways forward because we are continuously trying to maintain the peace," Marcos said ahead of a meeting with Xi at the sidelines of the APEC Summit in San Francisco翻译:APEC峰会在旧金山举行.翻译:马科斯在旧金山亚太经合组织峰会期间与习近平会面之前表示：“我们将制定前进的道路，因为我们一直在努力维护和平。”

Marcos said he also discussed South China Sea issues with U.S. Vice President Kamala Harris.翻译:马科斯表示，他还与美国副总统卡马拉·哈里斯讨论了南海问题。

China's embassy in Manila did not immediately respond to a request for comment.翻译:中国驻马尼拉大使馆没有立即回应置评请求。

China claims sovereignty over nearly the entire South China Sea, pointing to a line on its maps that cuts into the exclusive economic zones of Vietnam, the Philippines, Malaysia, Brunei and Indonesia. Taiwan, which China also claims as part of its territory, has said it does not accept Beijing's maps.翻译:中国声称对几乎整个南海拥有主权，并指出其地图上有一条线切入了越南、菲律宾、马来西亚、文莱和印度尼西亚的专属经济区。中国也声称台湾是其领土的一部分，台湾已表示不接受北京的地图。

The Permanent Court of Arbitration in 2016 said the line on China's maps had no legal basis, which Beijing rejects.翻译:2016年，常设仲裁法院表示，中国地图上的这条线没有法律依据，但北京方面对此予以否认。

The Philippines' foreign ministry on Thursday committed to continue resupply missions and an "upkeep" of a grounded navy ship in a disputed South China Sea atoll, saying it does not have to give prior notice to China.翻译:菲律宾外交部周四承诺继续执行补给任务，并对一艘在有争议的南海环礁搁浅的海军舰艇进行“维护”，并表示无需事先通知中国。

The Department of Foreign Affairs also called on China to remove all "illegal structures" it built within the Philippines' exclusive economic zone, cease reclamation in those areas and be accountable for the damage the activities caused.翻译:外交部还呼吁中国拆除在菲律宾专属经济区内建造的所有“非法建筑”，停止在这些地区进行填海造地活动，并对活动造成的损害承担责任。

Reporting by Neil Jerome Morales Editing by Shri Navaratnam and Michael Perry翻译:尼尔·杰罗姆·莫拉莱斯报道 Shri Navaratnam 和迈克尔·佩里编辑

item.title: 日元迎来四个月以来最好的一周，美元则每周下跌
item.description:
The yen was on track for its best week against the dollar in four months on Friday on the prospect of a narrowing U.S.-Japan rate differential, with bets that the Federal Reserve is done raising rates leaving the greenback headed for a weekly loss.翻译:由于美日利差收窄的前景，周五日元兑美元汇率有望创四个月来最佳单周表现，押注美联储将完成加息，导致美元每周下跌。

A slew of weaker-than-expected U.S. economic data released this week, led by a slowdown in inflation, has reinforced market expectations that the Fed has reached the end of its aggressive monetary tightening cycle, with focus now on when the first rate cuts could begin.翻译:在通胀放缓的带动下，本周公布的一系列弱于预期的美国经济数据强化了市场预期，即美联储激进的货币紧缩周期已经结束，目前的焦点是何时可以首次降息。开始。

Market pricing shows just a 0.3% chance of another rate hike in December, as compared to a roughly 15% chance a week ago, with a 35% chance that the U.S. central bank could begin easing monetary conditions as early as next March, according to the CME FedWatch tool.翻译:市场定价显示，12 月再次加息的可能性仅为 0.3%，而一周前的可能性约为 15%，美联储最早在明年 3 月开始放松货币政策的可能性为 35%。芝商所 FedWatch 工具。

That's led to a decline in U.S. Treasury yields alongside a fall in the dollar, which was on track to lose nearly 0.6% on the yen for the week, its worst weekly performance since July.翻译:这导致美国国债收益率下降，美元贬值，美元兑日元本周有望下跌近0.6%，这是自7月份以来最糟糕的单周表现。

Against the greenback, the euro and sterling were likewise eyeing a weekly jump of more than 1.5% each, while the dollar index was on track to lose 1.3%.翻译:欧元和英镑兑美元汇率同样有望每周上涨 1.5% 以上，而美元指数有望下跌 1.3%。

The euro steadied at $1.0851, while sterling last bought $1.2412.翻译:欧元稳定在 1.0851 美元，而英镑最后买入 1.2412 美元。

"The market reaction to the (U.S.) CPI was very substantial given that the inflation miss was only quite small, and that's a bad sign for the dollar going forward," said Sean Callow, a senior currency strategist at Westpac.翻译:西太平洋银行(Westpac)高级货币策略师肖恩·卡洛(Sean Callow)表示，“考虑到通胀偏差很小，市场对(美国)消费者物价指数(CPI)的反应非常强烈，这对美元未来走势来说是一个坏信号。”

"It might set up a narrative whereby the markets start talking about the FOMC statement in December as not only being rates on hold but... that they might go to a more neutral stance."翻译:“这可能会形成一种叙事，即市场开始谈论联邦公开市场委员会 (FOMC) 12 月的声明，不仅是维持利率不变，而且……他们可能会采取更加中性的立场。”

Separate data released this week showed U.S. retail sales fell for the first time in seven months in October, while signs of a cooling U.S. labour market continue to build as the number of Americans filing new claims for unemployment benefits increased to a three-month high last week.翻译:本周公布的另一项数据显示，美国 10 月份零售额出现七个月以来的首次下降，而美国劳动力市场降温的迹象继续显现，因为去年美国新申请失业救济人数增加至三个月高位。星期。

The Japanese yen last stood at 150.72 per dollar , remaining on the weaker side of the 150 threshold and not far from Monday's one-year low of 151.92 per dollar.翻译:日元兑美元最新报150.72，仍处于150关口下方，距离周一的一年低点151.92不远。

Despite a possible peak in U.S. rates and even as insiders believe the Bank of Japan (BOJ) is priming markets for an end to negative interest rates, the wide gap between Japan's ultra-low rates and those in the United States continues to keep the yen under pressure.翻译:尽管美国利率可能达到峰值，而且内部人士认为日本央行（BOJ）正在推动市场结束负利率，但日本超低利率与美国利率之间的巨大差距继续令日元保持升值在压力之下。

"I think (the BOJ) is still going to err on the cautious side. It's our house view that they don't touch policy settings for many, many months, so deep into next year," said Callow.翻译:卡洛表示：“我认为（日本央行）仍会在谨慎方面犯错。我们的内部观点是，他们在很多、很多个月内都不会触及政策设置，直到明年。”

"If that's the case, then yes, the U.S. dollar will probably have less yield appeal, but we don't think it's enough to really turn the tide -- the gap is just still so wide."翻译:“如果是这样的话，那么是的，美元的收益率吸引力可能会降低，但我们认为这不足以真正扭转局势——差距仍然如此之大。”

Elsewhere, the Australian and New Zealand dollars were likewise eyeing weekly gains of 1.7% and 1.3%, respectively, helped by the slide in the greenback.翻译:其他方面，在美元下跌的帮助下，澳元和新西兰元同样预计每周分别上涨 1.7% 和 1.3%。

The Aussie was last 0.08% lower at $0.6466, having showed little reaction to upbeat Australian jobs data released in the previous session.翻译:澳元兑美元最后下跌 0.08%，至 0.6466 美元，对前一交易日公布的乐观澳大利亚就业数据反应不大。

The kiwi fell 0.14% to $0.5963.翻译:新西兰元下跌 0.14% 至 0.5963 美元。

Reporting by Rae Wee. Editing by Sam Holmes翻译:雷威报道。山姆·霍姆斯编辑

item.title: 独家：应用材料公司因向中国中芯国际供货而受到美国刑事调查-消息来源
item.description:
Semiconductor equipment maker Applied Materials (AMAT.O) is under U.S. criminal investigation for potentially evading export restrictions on China's top chipmaker SMIC, according to three people familiar with the matter.翻译:据三位知情人士透露，半导体设备制造商应用材料公司(AMAT.O)因可能逃避中国顶级芯片制造商中芯国际的出口限制而正在接受美国刑事调查。

The largest U.S. semiconductor equipment maker is being probed by the Justice Department for sending equipment to SMIC via South Korea without export licenses, the sources said. Hundreds of millions of dollars of equipment is involved, one of the people said. Reuters is reporting details of the probe for the first time.翻译:消息人士称，美国最大的半导体设备制造商因在没有出口许可证的情况下通过韩国向中芯国际运送设备而受到司法部的调查。其中一位知情人士称，涉及的设备价值数亿美元。路透社首次报道了调查的细节。

Shares in Applied Materials fell 7.3% after the news and the company reported quarterly results.翻译:消息传出并公布季度业绩后，应用材料公司股价下跌 7.3%。

The U.S. has restricted shipments of advanced chips and chipmaking equipment to China for national security, and the Justice and Commerce departments launched a task force earlier this year to investigate and prosecute criminal violations of export controls. The rules are aimed at stemming the flow of U.S. technology that could be used to bolster China's military and intelligence capabilities.翻译:出于国家安全考虑，美国限制向中国出口先进芯片和芯片制造设备，司法部和商务部今年早些时候成立了一个特别工作组， 调查和起诉违反出口管制的刑事犯罪行为。这些规则旨在阻止可用于增强中国军事和情报能力的美国技术的流动。

Santa Clara, California-based Applied Materials said Thursday it first disclosed in October 2022 that it had received a subpoena from the U.S. Attorney's Office in Massachusetts for information on certain China customer shipments."The company is cooperating with the government and remains committed to compliance and global laws, including export controls and trade regulations," it said in a statement.翻译:总部位于加利福尼亚州圣克拉拉的应用材料公司周四表示，该公司于 2022 年 10 月首次披露，已收到马萨诸塞州美国检察官办公室的传票，要求提供有关某些中国客户发货的信息。“该公司正在与政府合作，并仍然致力于合规以及全球法律，包括出口管制和贸易法规，”它在一份声明中表示。

The U.S. Attorney's office in Boston said: "We do not confirm or deny investigations."翻译:波士顿美国检察官办公室表示：“我们不确认也不否认调查。”

Prosecutors in the office's National Security Unit are handling the ongoing probe, two sources said.翻译:两名消息人士称，该办公室国家安全部门的检察官正在处理正在进行的调查。

Reuters could not determine whether Applied Materials violated the law, and it isn't clear whether the investigation will result in charges.翻译:路透社无法确定应用材料公司是否违反了法律，也不清楚调查是否会导致指控。

The company produced semiconductor equipment in Massachusetts, then repeatedly shipped the equipment from its plant in Gloucester to a subsidiary in South Korea, the people said. From there, the equipment went to China's Semiconductor Manufacturing International Corporation (SMIC), the people, familiar with the probe, said.翻译:知情人士称，该公司在马萨诸塞州生产半导体设备，然后多次将设备从格洛斯特的工厂运往韩国的一家子公司。知情人士称，这些设备从那里被运往中国半导体制造国际公司（SMIC）。

The shipments began after the U.S. Commerce Department added SMIC to its "Entity List" in December 2020, which restricted exports of goods and technology to the company, two of the sources said, and took place in 2021 and 2022.翻译:两位消息人士称，美国商务部于 2020 年 12 月将中芯国际列入“实体名单”，限制向该公司出口货物和技术，随后开始发货，发货时间为 2021 年和 2022 年。

SMIC was placed on the list over its apparent ties to the Chinese military. SMIC did not immediately respond to a request for comment on the shipments from Applied Materials. In 2020, SMIC denied ties with the Chinese military, saying that it manufactures chips and provides services "solely for civilian and commercial end-users and end-uses."翻译:中芯国际因其与中国军方的明显关系而被列入名单。中芯国际没有立即回应对应用材料公司发货的置评请求。 2020年，中芯国际否认与中国军方有联系，称其制造芯片并提供服务“仅为民用和商业最终用户和最终用途”。

A spokesperson for the Commerce Department, which oversees export controls, declined comment. A spokesperson for China's embassy in Washington was not aware of the Applied Materials probe. But Liu Pengyu, the spokesperson, said that, as a general principle, "imposed restrictions" are "at odds with market economy principles and fair competition."

SUBJECT TO UNCERTAINTIES

In adding SMIC to its trade blacklist in 2020, the Commerce Department said that licenses for equipment uniquely capable of producing chips at advanced technology nodes are likely to be denied to "prevent such key enabling technology from supporting China’s military modernization efforts,” according to a 2020 posting in the Federal Register.翻译:据一份报告称，美国商务部在 2020 年将中芯国际列入贸易黑名单时表示，可能会拒绝发放具有独特能力在先进技术节点生产芯片的设备的许可证，以“阻止此类关键支持技术支持中国的军事现代化努力”。 2020 年在《联邦公报》上发布。

Licenses for other items are subject to a case-by-case review, it added.翻译:它补充说，其他项目的许可证需要根据具体情况进行审查。

In March 2021, Reuters reported that the U.S. government had been slow to approve licenses for American companies like Lam Research Corp and Applied Materials to sell to SMIC.翻译:2021 年 3 月，路透社报道称，美国政府在批准泛林集团和应用材料公司等美国公司向中芯国际出售产品的许可方面进展缓慢。

"This matter is subject to uncertainties, and we cannot predict the outcome, nor reasonably estimate a range of loss or penalties, if any, relating to this matter," the company said in an August 2023 filing with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission, in reference to its 2022 receipt of the subpoena relating to certain China customer shipments.翻译:该公司在 2023 年 8 月向美国证券交易委员会提交的文件中表示：“此事存在不确定性，我们无法预测结果，也无法合理估计与此事相关的一系列损失或处罚（如有）。”提及其于 2022 年收到与某些中国客户发货有关的传票。

Reporting by Karen Freifeld; Editing by Anna Driver翻译:凯伦·弗赖菲尔德报道；编辑：安娜·德赖弗

item.title: 习近平表示中国已准备好成为APEC合作伙伴
item.description:
Summary:
  • Xi attends dinner with US executives, officials
  • Apple, BlackRock, Pfizer among the firms represented
  • Controversy over reported high ticket cost
翻译:概括：
  • 习近平与美国高管和官员共进晚餐
  • 代表公司包括苹果、贝莱德、辉瑞
  • 票价高引发争议

China is ready to be a partner and friend of the United States, and there is plenty of room for bilateral cooperation, President Xi Jinping told American executives in San Francisco on Wednesday, as Beijing looks to reassure global business and counter his country's struggles to entice foreign investment.翻译:周三，国家主席习近平在旧金山对美国高管表示，中国已准备好成为美国的伙伴和朋友，双边合作还有很大空间，北京方面希望安抚全球企业，并应对中国在吸引全球企业方面的努力。外来投资。

The U.S. executives dined with Xi on the margins of the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) forum following a day of talks between the Chinese leader and U.S. President Joe Biden, aimed at steadying relations between the world's two largest economies.翻译:在中国领导人与美国总统乔·拜登进行了一天的会谈后，美国高管在亚太经合组织（APEC）论坛间隙与习近平共进晚餐，会谈旨在稳定世界两大经济体之间的关系。

Xi received a standing ovation as he entered the room, and two more before and after he took the stage to speak.翻译:习近平一走进房间就受到了全场起立鼓掌，在他上台讲话前后，又有两次起立鼓掌。

The world needs China and the U.S. to work together, and it is wrong to view China as a threat and play a zero-sum game against it, Xi said in a speech to the audience, including some hand-picked by Beijing.翻译:习近平在向观众发表的讲话中表示，世界需要中美共同努力，将中国视为威胁并与之玩零和游戏的做法是错误的。

"Whatever stage of development it may reach, China will never pursue hegemony or expansion, and will never impose its will on others. China does not seek spheres of influence, and will not fight a cold war or a hot war with anyone," Xi said.翻译:“无论发展到什么阶段，中国永远不称霸、永远不扩张，永远不会把自己的意志强加于人。中国不谋求势力范围，不会同任何人打冷战、热战。”说。

He assured his audience that "no matter how the global landscape evolves, the historical trend of peaceful coexistence between China and the United States will not change."翻译:他向观众保证，“无论世界格局如何变化，中美和平共处的历史潮流都不会改变”。

Xi's optimistic tone toward relations with the U.S. was at odds with the negative chorus of voices in Washington, where the U.S. Congress finds unusual bipartisan consensus in the need to counter Beijing.翻译:习近平对中美关系的乐观态度与华盛顿的负面声音不一致，美国国会发现两党在对抗北京方面达成了不同寻常的共识。

The high-security dinner was a chance for companies to hear directly from China's leader as they search for ways to navigate China's economic slowdown, a U.S. push to "de-risk" some American supply chains away from China, and uncertainty caused by China's expanding security rules.翻译:这次高度安全的晚宴为企业提供了直接听取中国领导人讲话的机会，因为它们正在寻找应对中国经济放缓、美国推动部分美国供应链远离中国“降低风险”以及中国扩张带来的不确定性的方法。安全规则。

Executives from U.S. corporate giants such as Apple's (AAPL.O) Tim Cook, BlackRock's (BLK.N) Laurence Fink, Broadcom's (AVGO.O) Hock Tan, Bridgewater Associates' Ray Dalio and Pfizer's (PFE.N) Albert Bourla were at the dinner tables.翻译:苹果(AAPL.O)蒂姆·库克 (Tim Cook)、贝莱德(BLK.N)劳伦斯·芬克 (Laurence Fink)、博通(AVGO.O) Hock Tan、Bridgewater Associates 雷·达里奥 (Ray Dalio) 和辉瑞(PFE.N)艾伯特·布尔拉 (Albert Bourla) 等美国企业巨头的高管出席了会议。餐桌。

Xi also met Tesla (TSLA.O) CEO Elon Musk, telling him that he supports the company's development in China, according to a statement from the auto maker's Weibo Account on Thursday.翻译:根据特斯拉微博周四发布的声明，习近平还会见了特斯拉(TSLA.O)首席执行官埃隆·马斯克，告诉他支持该公司在中国的发展。

The dinner, where courses served included coffee-crusted black angus flat iron steak and a vegetable curry with squash and rice, attracted nearly 400 people, including government officials and academics.翻译:晚宴上的菜肴包括咖啡皮黑安格斯扁铁牛排和蔬菜咖喱配南瓜和米饭，吸引了近 400 人参加，其中包括政府官员和学者。

But Xi directed much of his speech toward the American people and spent little time on commercial relations with the U.S.翻译:但习近平的讲话大部分针对美国人民，很少讨论与美国的商业关系

"I would like to let you know that China sympathizes deeply with the American people, especially the young, for the sufferings that fentanyl has inflicted upon them," he said.翻译:他说：“我想让你知道，中方对美国人民特别是年轻人因芬太尼给他们造成的痛苦深表同情。”

Biden and Xi earlier reached an agreement on working together to curb fentanyl production.

CONTROVERSY

U.S. Commerce Secretary Gina Raimondo and other senior U.S. officials also attended the event, which generated controversy due to reported high ticket costs for companies seeking to brush shoulders with Xi.翻译:美国商务部长吉娜·雷蒙多和其他美国高级官员也出席了此次活动，但由于有报道称寻求与习近平擦肩而过的企业票价高昂，此次活动引起了争议。

Mike Gallagher, the Republican chairman of the U.S. House of Representatives' select committee on China, had called it "unconscionable" that U.S. companies would pay thousands of dollars to join a dinner with a government the United States says is committing genocide against Muslim Uyghurs.翻译:美国众议院中国问题特别委员会共和党主席迈克·加拉格尔(Mike Gallagher)称，美国公司愿意支付数千美元与美国称正在对穆斯林维吾尔人实施种族灭绝的政府共进晚餐，这是“不合理的”。

Gallagher sent a letter on Monday to the hosts – the U.S.-China Business Council and the National Committee on U.S.-China Relations – demanding a complete list of individuals and companies that purchased tickets to the dinner.翻译:加拉格尔周一致函东道主美中贸易全国委员会和美中关系全国委员会，要求提供购买晚宴门票的个人和公司的完整名单。

Analysts have said Xi's speech alone is unlikely to dramatically alter U.S. business sentiment about China.翻译:分析人士表示，仅习近平的讲话不太可能大幅改变美国企业对中国的信心。

U.S. and Chinese officials have often described bilateral business and trade relations as the ballast in otherwise contentious ties with the U.S. But the growing economic and geopolitical rivalry between the superpowers has placed companies from both countries in the crosshairs of the other's government.翻译:美国和中国官员经常将双边商业和贸易关系描述为中美其他有争议关系的压舱石。但这两个超级大国之间日益激烈的经济和地缘政治竞争使两国企业成为对方政府的攻击目标。

China has grown more suspicious of engagement with Western companies, in line with Xi's emphasis on self-reliance and national security, and this year it has cracked down on some U.S. consultancy and due-diligence firms, further damaging investor confidence.翻译:随着习近平强调自力更生和国家安全，中国对与西方公司的接触变得更加怀疑，今年中国还打压了一些美国咨询和尽职调查公司，进一步损害了投资者的信心。

But Gary Dvorchak, whose family hosted Xi in Iowa in 1985 as a young Chinese official, and who was invited by Beijing to attend the dinner, said Xi's appearance was savvy public relations, allowing the ruling Communist Party to show his appeal to regular people.翻译:但加里·德沃尔查克(Gary Dvorchak)表示，习近平的出现是精明的公共关系，让执政的共产党向普通民众展示了他的吸引力。1985年，习近平还是一名年轻的中国官员，他的家人在爱荷华州接待了习近平，他还应北京邀请参加了晚宴。

"It humanizes him and it gives him an ability to show a connection to the American people and bypass the American media," Dvorchak said.翻译:德沃查克说：“这使他变得人性化，使他能够绕过美国媒体，展现出与美国人民的联系。”

Reporting by Michael Martina, Valerie Insinna, Stephen Nellis, Lisa Baertlein, Niket Nishant; Aditional reporting by Ethan Wang and Liz Lee in Beijing; Editing by Stephen Coates and Josie Kao翻译:Michael Martina、Valerie Insinna、Stephen Nellis、Lisa Baertlein、Niket Nishant 报道； Ethan Wang 和 Liz Lee 在北京的补充报道；斯蒂芬·科茨和乔西·高编辑

item.title: 美国、印太伙伴明年需要“重新调整”贸易谈判——美国贸易代表比安奇
item.description:
The U.S. and its Indo-Pacific Economic Framework partners need to regroup and "recalibrate" their trade pillar negotiations early next year after three negotiating rounds in the past two months fell short of substantial agreements, Deputy U.S. Trade Representative Sarah Bianchi told Reuters on Thursday.翻译:美国副贸易代表莎拉·比安奇周四对路透社表示，在过去两个月的三轮谈判未能达成实质性协议后，美国及其印太经济框架伙伴需要在明年初重新组合和“重新调整”其贸易支柱谈判。

Bianchi said in an interview that USTR will announce that progress had been made on the language of IPEF trade chapters, but that work will continue.翻译:比安奇在接受采访时表示，美国贸易代表办公室将宣布在 IPEF 贸易章节的语言方面取得了进展，但这项工作将继续进行。

"We’ve got to recalibrate in the new year with our partners," Bianchi said on the sidelines of the Asia Pacific Economic Cooperation summit in San Francisco. "We have a little different path for next year than we thought because some of the pieces are still ongoing."翻译:比安奇在旧金山亚太经济合作组织峰会期间表示：“我们必须在新的一年里与我们的合作伙伴重新调整。” “明年我们的道路与我们想象的有些不同，因为有些工作仍在进行中。”

The failure to complete at least some chapters in the IPEF trade pillar is a setback for President Joe Biden, who had aimed to showcase the initiative during the APEC summit as a symbol of U.S. economic re-engagement in Asia that would provide countries a counterweight to China's growing trade clout in the region.翻译:未能完成 IPEF 贸易支柱中的至少某些章节对乔·拜登总统来说是一个挫折，他原本打算在 APEC 峰会期间展示该倡议，将其作为美国经济重新参与亚洲的象征，这将为各国提供制衡力量。中国在该地区的贸易影响力不断增强。

Bianchi acknowledged that election-year politics could complicate next year's negotiations. Another Asian trade deal, the Trans-Pacific Partnership, died during the 2016 election campaign.翻译:比安奇承认，选举年的政治可能会使明年的谈判变得复杂。另一项亚洲贸易协定《跨太平洋伙伴关系协定》在 2016 年竞选期间夭折。

Senator Sherrod Brown, a Democrat facing a tough re-election fight in the industrial state of Ohio, last week demanded that Biden drop the trade pillar from the Indo-Pacific initiative. Brown on Wednesday claimed responsibility for the stalling IPEF trade pillar by insisting on enforceable labor provisions.翻译:民主党参议员谢罗德·布朗在工业州俄亥俄州面临着艰难的连任斗争，他上周要求拜登放弃印太倡议中的贸易支柱。周三，布朗声称对 IPEF 贸易支柱的停滞负有责任，因为他坚持强制执行劳工条款。

Some countries, including Vietnam and Indonesia, had rejected U.S. demands for labor rights standards to be enforced through a dispute settlement system similar to that in the U.S.-Canada-Mexico agreement on trade, according to people briefed on the talks.翻译:据了解谈判情况的人士透露，包括越南和印度尼西亚在内的一些国家拒绝了美国提出的通过类似于美国-加拿大-墨西哥贸易协议中的争端解决制度来执行劳工权利标准的要求。

Bianchi said some of the other 12 IPEF countries in the trade talks "prefer a different approach" on labor and environment chapters, but they support continued negotiations on trade. "Partners are committed to the work. They want to keep the process going."翻译:比安奇表示，参加贸易谈判的其他 12 个 IPEF 国家中的一些国家“更喜欢在劳工和环境章节上采取不同的做法”，但他们支持继续进行贸易谈判。 “合作伙伴致力于这项工作。他们希望让这个过程继续下去。”

She said that even without benefits such as tariff reductions, IPEF partners see value in provisions on good regulatory practices, trade facilitation and agriculture, which will help drive investment to their economies.翻译:她表示，即使没有关税削减等好处，IPEF 合作伙伴也看到了良好监管实践、贸易便利化和农业条款的价值，这将有助于推动对其经济的投资。

Reporting by David Lawder; Editing by David Gregorio翻译:大卫·劳德报道；编辑：大卫·格雷戈里奥

item.title: 拜登和习近平“直言不讳”的会谈达成了军事、芬太尼方面的协议
item.description:
U.S. President Joe Biden and Chinese leader Xi Jinping agreed on Wednesday to open a presidential hotline, resume military-to-military communications and work to curb fentanyl production, showing tangible progress in their first face-to-face talks in a year.翻译:美国总统乔·拜登和中国领导人习近平周三同意开通总统热线、恢复军队间沟通以及遏制芬太尼生产，这在一年来首次面对面会谈中取得了切实进展。

Biden and Xi met for about four hours on the outskirts of San Francisco to discuss issues that have strained U.S.-Chinese relations. Simmering differences remain, particularly over Taiwan.翻译:拜登和习近平在旧金山郊区会面约四个小时，讨论导致美中关系紧张的问题。分歧依然存在，尤其是在台湾问题上。

In a significant breakthrough, the two governments plan to resume military contacts that China severed after then-House of Representatives Speaker Nancy Pelosi visited Taiwan in August 2022.翻译:两国政府计划恢复中国在时任众议院议长南希·佩洛西于 2022 年 8 月访问台湾后中断的军事接触，这是一项重大突破。

“We’re back to direct, open clear direct communication on a direct basis,” Biden said.翻译:拜登说：“我们回到了直接、公开、明确的直接沟通。”

In addition, Biden said he and Xi agreed to high-level communications. "He and I agreed that each one of us can pick up the phone call directly and we'll be heard immediately."翻译:此外，拜登表示，他和习近平同意进行高层沟通。 “他和我同意我们每个人都可以直接接听电话，我们会立即听到。”

But in a comment likely to irk the Chinese, Biden told reporters later that he had not changed his view that Xi is a dictator.翻译:但拜登后来对记者表示，他并没有改变对习近平是独裁者的看法，这可能会激怒中国人。

"Well, look, he is. I mean, he’s a dictator in the sense that he is a guy who runs a country that is a communist country," Biden said.翻译:“嗯，看，他是。我的意思是，他是一个独裁者，因为他管理着一个共产主义国家，”拜登说。

Xi told Biden that the negative views of the Communist Party in the United States were unfair, a U.S. official told reporters after the meeting.翻译:一位美国官员在会后告诉记者，习近平告诉拜登，美国共产党的负面看法是不公平的。

Biden and Xi came into the talks looking to smooth over a rocky period in relations that took a turn for the worse after a suspected Chinese surveillance balloon transited the United States and was shot down by a U.S. fighter jet in February.翻译:拜登和习近平参加会谈是为了缓和两国关系的不稳定时期，自二月份一个疑似中国监视气球飞越美国并被一架美国战斗机击落后，两国关系变得更糟。

The White House said Biden raised areas where Washington has concerns, including detained U.S. citizens, human rights in Xinjiang, Tibet and Hong Kong and Beijing’s aggressive activities in the South China Sea.翻译:白宫表示，拜登提出了华盛顿关切的领域，包括被拘留的美国公民、新疆、西藏和香港的人权以及北京在南中国海的侵略活动。

"Just talking, just being blunt with one another so there’s no misunderstanding," Biden said.

MILITARY, TAIWAN

U.S. and China's militaries have had a number of near-misses and acrimonious exchanges over the past year. After the pledge to renew communications, U.S. Secretary of Defense Lloyd Austin will meet his Chinese counterpart when that person is named, a senior U.S. official said.翻译:过去一年里，美国和中国军队发生了多次险些失手和激烈的交锋。一位美国高级官员表示，在承诺恢复沟通后，美国国防部长劳埃德·奥斯汀将在中国国防部长被任命后与其会面。

Biden and Xi agreed China would stem the export of items related to the production of the opioid fentanyl, a leading cause of drug overdoses in the United States. "It’s going to save lives,” Biden said, adding he appreciated Xi’s “commitment” on the issue.翻译:拜登和习近平一致同意，中国将阻止与阿片类药物芬太尼生产相关的产品出口， 阿片类药物芬太尼是美国吸毒过量的主要原因。拜登说：“这将拯救生命。”他补充说，他赞赏习近平在这个问题上的“承诺”。

Under the agreement, China will go directly after specific chemical companies that make fentanyl precursors, a senior U.S. official told reporters. He vowed to "trust but verify" Chinese actions on the drug.翻译:一位美国高级官员告诉记者，根据协议，中国将直接打击生产芬太尼前体的特定化学公司。他发誓要“信任但核实”中国对该药物的行动。

The two leaders also agreed to get experts together to discuss the risks of artificial intelligence.翻译:两位领导人还同意召集专家讨论人工智能的风险。

A U.S. official described an exchange over Taiwan, the democratic island that China claims as its territory. China's preference is for peaceful reunification with the Chinese-claimed island of Taiwan, Xi told Biden, the U.S. official said, but Xi went on to talk about conditions in which force could be used.翻译:一名美国官员描述了一场围绕台湾问题的交流，中国声称台湾是其领土。这位美国官员表示，习近平告诉拜登，中国倾向于和平统一中国声称拥有主权的台湾岛，但习近平接着谈到了可以使用武力的条件。

Biden said he stressed the need for peace and stability in the Taiwan Strait. The U.S. official said Biden argued to maintain the status quo and for China to respect Taiwan's electoral process.翻译:拜登表示，他强调台海需要和平与稳定。这位美国官员表示，拜登主张维持现状，并要求中国尊重台湾的选举程序。

"President Xi responded 'Look, peace is all well and good, but at some point we need to move towards resolution more generally'," the official quoted Xi as saying.翻译:这位官员援引习近平的话说：“习主席回应道，‘看，和平固然很好，但在某些时候我们需要更广泛地解决问题’。”

Xi also urged the United States to stop sending weapons to Taiwan and support China's peaceful "reunification" with Taiwan, Chinese state media said.翻译:中国官方媒体称，习近平还敦促美国停止向台湾运送武器，支持中国与台湾和平“统一”。

Bonnie Glaser, a Taiwan expert at the Germen Marshall Fund of the United States, said Xi seemed to have conveyed both threats and assurances on Taiwan.翻译:美国德国马歇尔基金会台湾问题专家葛来仪表示，习近平似乎既传达了对台湾的威胁，又传达了保证。

"The suggestion that a resolution needs to be found in the near term is a worrisome sign, even if he emphasized that there are no plans for military action against Taiwan in the coming years," she said.翻译:“尽管他强调未来几年没有计划对台湾采取军事行动，但需要在短期内找到解决方案的建议是一个令人担忧的迹象，”她说。

Biden said he asked Xi to use his influence with Iran to urge Tehran not to launch proxy attacks on U.S. targets in the Middle East as the Israel-Hamas conflict continues in Gaza.

RESPECT AND WARMTH

Biden welcomed the Chinese leader at the Filoli estate, a country house and well-manicured gardens about 30 miles (48 km) south of San Francisco, where they will move later for a summit of the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) forum.翻译:拜登在位于旧金山以南约 30 英里（48 公里）的菲洛丽庄园迎接了中国领导人，菲洛丽庄园是一座乡间别墅，花园修剪整齐，稍后他们将前往那里参加亚太经济合作组织 (APEC) 论坛峰会。

APEC meets amid relative Chinese economic weakness, Beijing's territorial feuds with neighbors and a Middle East conflict that is dividing the United States from allies.翻译:亚太经合组织召开之际， 中国经济相对疲软，北京与邻国之间存在领土争端，而中东冲突则导致美国与盟友分裂。

Xi came into the meeting looking for respect from the United States as China's economy struggles to recover from sluggish growth.翻译:在中国经济努力从增长乏力中复苏之际，习近平参加会议是为了寻求美国的尊重。

Biden, who had long sought the meeting, struck a warm, welcoming tone. Video of the two clasping hands in farewell after the meeting was posted on X by the Global Times, China's state-backed tabloid.翻译:拜登长期以来一直寻求这次会面，他的语气热情而欢迎。中国官方小报《环球时报》在X上发布了两人会面后握手告别的视频。

"Planet Earth is big enough for the two countries to succeed," Xi told Biden as they and their delegations sat across from each other at a long table in an ornate conference room.翻译:“地球足够大，足以让两国取得成功，”习近平和两国代表团在一间华丽的会议室里面对面坐在一张长桌旁时对拜登说。

Biden said the U.S. and China had to ensure that competition between them "does not veer into conflict" and manage their relationship "responsibly."翻译:拜登表示，美国和中国必须确保两国之间的竞争“不会演变成冲突”，并“负责任地” 管理两国关系。

After lunch, the leaders took a short walk together in the manicured garden of the mansion following an interaction that lasted around four hours. Biden waved to reporters and gave a two thumbs up sign when asked how the talks were going. "Well," he said.翻译:午餐后，两位领导人在豪宅修剪整齐的花园里一起散步，并进行了大约四个小时的互动。当被问及谈判进展如何时，拜登向记者挥手并竖起两个大拇指。 “好吧，”他说。

Xi told Biden as they began their talks a lot had happened since their last meeting a year ago in Bali, citing the impacts of the COVID pandemic, and calling the U.S.-China relationship "the most important bilateral relationship in the world."翻译:习近平在会谈开始时告诉拜登，自一年前上次在巴厘岛举行会议以来发生了很多事情，并提到了新冠病毒大流行的影响，并称美中关系是“世界上最重要的双边关系”。

"For two large countries like China and the United States, turning their back on each other is not an option," he said. "It is unrealistic for one side to remodel the other."翻译:“对于中国和美国这样的两个大国来说，互相背弃不是一个选择，”他说。 “一方改造另一方是不现实的。”

After the two met, Biden welcomed global leaders to the APEC meeting in San Francisco, where he said Xi regarded the visit as a homecoming given the city’s large Chinese population.翻译:两人会面后，拜登欢迎全球领导人出席在旧金山举行的亚太经合组织会议，他表示，鉴于该市华人人口众多，习近平将这次访问视为一次回家。

item.title: 两国领导人同意促进贸易和投资，加强两国关系
item.description:
Mexico and China's leaders met on Thursday and committed to working together and strengthening ties, while agreeing to battle illegal drug trafficking between their nations and to push for more trade and investment.翻译:墨西哥和中国领导人周四会面，承诺共同努力，加强关系，同时同意打击两国之间的非法贩毒活动，并推动更多的贸易和投资。

The two met on the sidelines of the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) summit in San Francisco.翻译:两人在旧金山亚太经济合作组织（APEC）峰会期间会面。

China and Mexico's relationship has strengthened with time, Chinese President Xi Jinping said about the meeting, according to a post from the Asian country's embassy in Mexico, with Sino-Mexican relations becoming increasingly "mutually beneficial."翻译:据亚洲国家驻墨西哥大使馆发布的消息，中国国家主席习近平在谈到这次会面时表示，中国和墨西哥的关系随着时间的推移而不断加强，中墨关系变得越来越“互利共赢”。

The post added that China "is willing ... to strengthen the articulation of strategies, (and) explore the potential for cooperation ... to promote bilateral relations to a higher level."翻译:帖子还说，中国“愿意……加强战略对接，探索合作潜力……推动双边关系迈向更高水平”。

Mexico President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador said the two leaders had "committed to continue maintaining good relations for the benefit of our people."翻译:墨西哥总统安德烈斯·曼努埃尔·洛佩斯·奥夫拉多尔表示，两国领导人“致力于继续保持良好关系，造福我们人民”。

Lopez Obrador is also set to meet with Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau and U.S. President Joe Biden during the trip.翻译:洛佩兹·奥夫拉多尔还将在访问期间会见加拿大总理贾斯汀·特鲁多和美国总统乔·拜登。

The Biden administration has been seeking increased cooperation from both Mexico and China to stem the flow of fentanyl, a deadly opioid, and its precursor chemicals, which have fueled a sharp rise in overdose deaths in the United States.翻译:拜登政府一直在寻求墨西哥和中国加强合作，以阻止芬太尼（一种致命的阿片类药物）及其前体化学品的流动，这些化学品导致美国服药过量死亡人数急剧上升。

Lopez Obrador and Xi agreed to combat illegal trafficking of precursor chemicals, Mexican Foreign Minister Alicia Barcena said in a post on social media network X.翻译:墨西哥外交部长阿丽西娅·巴尔塞纳在社交媒体网络 X 上发帖称，洛佩斯·奥夫拉多尔和习近平同意打击前体化学品的非法贩运。

They also agreed to promote trade and investment, she added.翻译:她补充说，他们还同意促进贸易和投资。

The foreign ministry said in a separate post that Lopez Obrador spoke with Xi about two of his administration's keystone infrastructure projects, a solar energy development in the north of the country and the so-called Interoceanic Corridor to attract business to the south.翻译:外交部在另一篇文章中表示，洛佩斯·奥夫拉多尔与习近平讨论了其政府的两个重点基础设施项目，即该国北部的太阳能开发项目和旨在吸引南部商业的所谓跨洋走廊。

Reporting by Kylie Madry and Valentine Hilaire; Additional reporting by Isabel Woodford; Editing by Josie Kao and Stephen Coates翻译:凯莉·马德里和瓦伦丁·希莱尔报道；伊莎贝尔·伍德福德的补充报道；编辑：Josie Kao 和 Stephen Coates
item.author: Reuters

item.title: TikTok 将禁止宣传本拉登《致美国的信》的视频
item.description:
TikTok will prohibit content that promotes Osama bin Laden's 2002 letter detailing the former al Qaeda leader's justifications for attacks against Americans, the short-form video app said on Thursday.翻译:该短视频应用周四表示，TikTok 将禁止宣传奥萨马·本·拉登 2002 年信的内容，该信详细说明了这位前基地组织领导人袭击美国人的理由。

Discussions of the 20-year-old letter have spread on the platform this week in the context of debate over the Israel-Hamas war, with some users in the West praising its contents.翻译:本周，在以色列与哈马斯战争争论的背景下，关于这封 20 年前的信件的讨论在该平台上蔓延，一些西方用户赞扬了其内容。

The letter, which was written after al Qaeda's attack on the United States that killed nearly 3,000 people, criticized U.S. support for Israel, accused Americans of financing "oppression" of Palestinians, and contained antisemitic comments.翻译:这封信是在基地组织袭击美国造成近 3000 人死亡后写的，信中批评美国对以色列的支持，指责美国资助“压迫”巴勒斯坦人，并包含反犹太主义言论。

Bin Laden was killed in 2011 in Pakistan by a U.S. military special operations unit.翻译:本·拉登于 2011 年在巴基斯坦被美军特种作战部队击毙。

"Content promoting this letter clearly violates our rules on supporting any form of terrorism," TikTok said in a statement, adding that reports that it was "trending" on the platform were inaccurate.翻译:TikTok 在一份声明中表示：“宣传这封信的内容显然违反了我们支持任何形式恐怖主义的规定。”他补充说，有关该信在该平台上“流行”的报道是不准确的。

A search for "Letter to America" on TikTok surfaced no results on Thursday, with a notice that said the phrase may be associated with "content that violates our guidelines."翻译:周四，在 TikTok 上搜索“致美国的信”没有任何结果，并有一条通知称该短语可能与“违反我们准则的内容”相关。

Some U.S. lawmakers have called for a ban of the Chinese-owned app and had renewed their criticisms before Thursday's announcement.翻译:一些美国议员呼吁禁止这款中国应用程序，并在周四宣布之前再次提出批评。

Democratic Representative Josh Gottheimer said on Wednesday on X, formerly Twitter, that TikTok was "pushing pro-terrorist propaganda to influence Americans."翻译:周三，民主党众议员乔什·戈特海默 (Josh Gottheimer) 在 X（前 Twitter）上表示，TikTok 正在“推动反恐怖主义宣传，以影响美国人”。

White House spokesperson Andrew Bates said in a statement on Thursday: "There is never a justification for spreading the repugnant, evil, and antisemitic lies that the leader of al Qaeda issued just after committing the worst terrorist attack in American history."翻译:白宫发言人安德鲁·贝茨周四在一份声明中表示：“基地组织领导人在发动美国历史上最严重的恐怖袭击后不久就发表了令人厌恶的、邪恶的和反犹太主义的谎言，这是没有理由散布的。”

On Wednesday, The Guardian removed the full text of bin Laden's letter, which it had published in 2002. The news outlet said on its website that the letter was being shared on social media without full context, and that it would instead direct readers to the news article that originally reported on the letter.翻译:周三，《卫报》删除了 2002 年发表的本·拉登信件的全文。该新闻媒体在其网站上表示，这封信在社交媒体上分享，但没有提供完整的背景信息，而是将读者引导至最初报道这封信的新闻文章。

TikTok said previously its recommendation algorithm does not push certain content to users, and that the company has removed hundreds of thousands of videos since Oct. 7 for violating policies against misinformation and promotion of violence.翻译:TikTok此前表示，其推荐算法不会向用户推送某些内容，并且自10月7日以来该公司已删除了数十万个视频，理由是违反了针对错误信息和宣扬暴力的政策。

It is difficult to gain a full understanding of how prevalent certain content is on TikTok, partly because external researchers have limited access to its data, said Renee DiResta, a research manager at Stanford Internet Observatory.翻译:斯坦福大学互联网观测站的研究经理蕾妮·迪雷斯塔 (Renee DiResta) 表示，很难全面了解 TikTok 上某些内容的流行程度，部分原因是外部研究人员对其数据的访问有限。

Reporting by Sheila Dang in Austin and David Shepardson in Washington, Editing by Rosalba O'Brien and David Gregorio翻译:奥斯汀的 Sheila Dang 和华盛顿的 David Shepardson 报道，Rosalba O'Brien 和 David Gregorio 编辑
item.author: Sheila Dang, David Shepardson

item.title: 秘鲁总统博卢阿特在会见中国习近平后谈到促进贸易
item.description:
Peruvian President Dina Boluarte met with Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping on Thursday, discussing major infrastructure projects and possible investments, her office said on social media.翻译:秘鲁总统迪娜·博卢阿特办公室在社交媒体上表示，周四会见了中国国家主席习近平，讨论了重大基础设施项目和可能的投资。

The two met on the sidelines of the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) forum in San Francisco, and discussed the Belt and Road Initiative, China's infrastructure project aimed at linking the country with the rest of the world.翻译:两人在旧金山亚太经济合作组织（APEC）论坛期间会面，讨论了“一带一路”倡议，即中国旨在连接中国与世界其他地区的基础设施项目。

Boluarte said that a megaport project in the coastal city of Chancay, currently under construction with Chinese funding, will be inaugurated in 2024 and provide a "significant boost to free trade and new Chinese investments."翻译:博卢阿特表示，目前由中国出资在沿海城市钱凯建设的一个大型港口项目将于 2024 年落成，并将“显着促进自由贸易和新的中国投资”。

Peru is scheduled to host the annual meeting of APEC country leaders next November, and Boluarte invited Xi to attend, her office said.翻译:秘鲁办公室表示，秘鲁定于明年11月主办亚太经合组织国家领导人年会，博卢阿特邀请习近平出席。

Reporting by Marco Aquino; Writing by Brendan O'Boyle; Editing by Anthony Esposito翻译:马可·阿基诺的报道；布伦丹·奥博伊尔撰写；安东尼·埃斯波西托编辑
item.author: Reuters

item.title: 早盘买盘：市场活跃，但周末即将消退
item.description:
A look at the day ahead in Asian markets from Jamie McGeever, financial markets columnist.翻译:金融市场专栏作家杰米·麦克吉弗 (Jamie McGeever) 对亚洲市场未来一天的展望。

Asian markets are poised to round off a positive week on a more subdued note on Friday, with concerns over world growth countering any optimism from another slide in U.S. Treasury yields and global oil prices.翻译:周五，亚洲市场将以更加疲软的基调结束积极的一周，对世界经济增长的担忧抵消了美国国债收益率和全球油价再次下滑带来的乐观情绪。

The Asia Pacific economic data and policy calendar on Friday is very light, with only Malaysian third quarter GDP and current account reports scheduled for release.翻译:周五的亚太经济数据和政策日历非常清淡，仅计划发布马来西亚第三季度国内生产总值和经常账户报告。

Malaysia's economy probably grew at a 3.0% annual rate in the July-September period, according to a Reuters poll, slightly faster than 2.9% in Q2. Ahead of the data the ringgit is trading around 4.6850 per dollar, near last month's 25-year low of 4.79 per dollar.翻译:根据路透社的调查，马来西亚经济在 7 月至 9 月期间的年增长率可能为 3.0％，略高于第二季度的 2.9％。数据公布前，令吉兑美元汇率约为4.6850，接近上个月创下的25年低点4.79令吉兑美元。

Anyone hoping for market-moving news from the Asia Pacific Economic Cooperation forum in San Francisco will have been disappointed. The gathering of APEC leaders has been cordial and cooperative but, viewed through an economic and market lens, lacking any real substance.翻译:任何希望从旧金山亚太经济合作论坛上获得影响市场消息的人都会失望。 APEC领导人的聚会是亲切和合作的，但从经济和市场的角度来看，缺乏任何实质内容。

The same largely applies to the much-anticipated summit between U.S. President Joe Biden and Chinese President Xi Jinping.翻译:这在很大程度上也适用于备受期待的美国总统乔·拜登和中国国家主席习近平之间的峰会。

Investor worries over the health of China's economy refuse to dissipate. The latest data show house prices fell for a fourth month in October and could fall further, and weak Japanese exports were in part due to soft demand from China.翻译:投资者对中国经济健康状况的担忧并未消散。最新数据显示，10月份房价连续第四个月下跌，并可能进一步下跌，而日本出口疲软部分原因是中国需求疲软。

Bucking the wider regional trend, China's CSI 300 blue chip index is poised for a slender decline, its first in four weeks.翻译:与更广泛的区域趋势相反，中国沪深 300 蓝筹股指数将出现四个星期以来的首次小幅下跌。

The MSCI Asia ex-Japan equity index is up 3.5% so far this week, its best week since July and third best of the year, and Japan's Nikkei 225 is set for its third weekly rise in a row, its best run since June.翻译:MSCI 亚洲（日本除外）股票指数本周迄今已上涨 3.5%，为 7 月以来的最佳一周，也是今年第三高的一周，日本日经 225 指数将连续第三周上涨，为 6 月以来的最佳表现。

The backdrop to Friday's market activity in Asia is further evidence that disinflationary pressures are spreading in the U.S. economy and beyond.翻译:周五亚洲市场活动的背景进一步证明通货紧缩压力正在美国经济及其他地区蔓延。

Data on Thursday showed that U.S. jobless claims rose to a three-month high and industrial production fell at its fastest rate this year. Capacity utilization slid to a two-year low, and global oil prices fell sharply again too - Brent crude futures hit a four-month low and are now down 16% year-on-year.翻译:周四的数据显示，美国初请失业金人数升至三个月高位，工业生产降幅创今年以来最快。产能利用率跌至两年低点，全球油价也再次大幅下跌——布伦特原油期货触及四个月低点，目前同比下跌16%。

Fading inflation puts downward pressure on interest rates and market borrowing costs, and U.S. Treasury yields fell as much as 10 basis points across the curve.翻译:通胀减弱给利率和市场借贷成本带来下行压力，美国国债收益率全线下跌多达10个基点。

All else equal, this weakens the dollar and supports risk assets like equities and emerging assets. But Wall Street failed to bounce and the dollar stood its ground on Thursday, hinting at a more defensive and cautious stance from many investors.翻译:在其他条件相同的情况下，这会削弱美元并支撑股票和新兴资产等风险资产。但华尔街未能反弹， 美元周四坚守阵地，暗示许多投资者采取了更加防御性和谨慎的立场。

If this filters through to Asia on Friday, the week may peter out with a whimper rather than a bang.翻译:如果这种情况在周五蔓延到亚洲，那么这一周可能会伴随着呜咽而不是一声巨响而结束。

Here are key developments that could provide more direction to markets on Friday:翻译:以下是周五可能为市场提供更多方向的关键进展：

- Malaysia current account (Q3)翻译:- 马来西亚经常账户（第三季度）

- Malaysia GDP (Q3)翻译:- 马来西亚国内生产总值（第三季度）

- Fed's Barr, Collins, Daly and Goolsbee speak翻译:- 美联储巴尔、柯林斯、戴利和古尔斯比讲话

By Jamie McGeever; Editing by Josie Kao翻译:作者：杰米·麦克吉弗；编辑：高乔茜

item.title: 美国议员对中国自动驾驶测试数据收集表示担忧
item.description:
A bipartisan group of U.S. lawmakers raised alarm about Chinese companies collecting and handling sensitive data while testing autonomous vehicles in the United States, according to letters seen by Reuters on Thursday.翻译:据路透社周四看到的信件，一个由美国两党议员组成的小组对中国公司在美国测试自动驾驶汽车时收集和处理敏感数据提出了警告。

The lawmakers, including House of Representatives Energy and Commerce Committee Chair Cathy McMorris Rodgers and China select committee Chair Mike Gallagher, asked 10 Chinese-related companies to answer questions by Nov. 29 on data collection practices from ongoing autonomous vehicle testing in California and elsewhere.翻译:包括众议院能源和商务委员会主席凯西·麦克莫里斯·罗杰斯和中国特别委员会主席迈克·加拉格尔在内的立法者要求 10 家与中国相关的公司在 11 月 29 日之前回答有关加州和其他地方正在进行的自动驾驶汽车测试的数据收集实践的问题。

The companies - including Baidu (9888.HK), Nio (9866.HK), WeRide, Didi Chuxing, Xpeng (9868.HK), Inceptio, Pony.ai, AutoX, Deeproute.ai and Qcraft - did not respond to requests for comment or could not immediately be reached.翻译:这些公司——包括百度（9888.HK） 、蔚来汽车（9866.HK） 、文远知行、滴滴出行、小鹏汽车（9868.HK） 、嬴彻科技、小马智行、AutoX、Deeproute.ai 和 Qcraft——均未回应请求。发表评论或无法立即联系到。

The previously unreported letters, also signed by Democrats Frank Pallone and Raja Krishnamoorti and 10 other lawmakers, said the companies "collect sensitive information about our citizens and their daily routines, the nation's infrastructure, and connected technologies."翻译:此前未报道的信件也由民主党人 Frank Pallone 和 Raja Krishnamoorti 以及其他 10 名立法者签署，信中称这些公司“收集有关我们公民及其日常生活、国家基础设施和互联技术的敏感信息”。

"There needs to be greater transparency around what information you collect while testing on American roads, and whether you are financially tied to the Chinese Communist Party," according to the previously unreported letters.翻译:根据此前未报道的信件，“在美国道路测试时收集的信息以及您是否与中国共产党有经济联系，需要提高透明度。”

The lawmakers asked what data is collected in the United States, whether it is stored in China, and if it is shared with the Chinese government or others. They also asked if the vehicles collect data on U.S. infrastructure during testing.翻译:议员们询问美国收集了哪些数据，这些数据是否存储在中国，以及是否与中国政府或其他方共享。他们还询问这些车辆是否在测试期间收集有关美国基础设施的数据。

The letters said in the 12 months ended November 2022 that Chinese AV companies test drove more than 450,000 miles in California. In July, Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg said his agency had national security concerns about Chinese autonomous vehicle companies in the United States.翻译:这些信件称，截至 2022 年 11 月的 12 个月内，中国自动驾驶汽车公司在加州试驾了超过 45 万英里。 7 月，交通部长皮特·布蒂吉格 (Pete Buttigieg) 表示，他的机构对中国自动驾驶汽车公司在美国的国家安全感到担忧。

"Whether we are talking about hardware or software, in the same way there are concerns around telecom or TikTok, there are concerns around transportation technologies," Buttigieg told Reuters.翻译:布蒂吉格对路透社表示：“无论我们谈论硬件还是软件，就像对电信或 TikTok 的担忧一样，对交通技术也存在担忧。”

item.title: 拜登取消对中国研究所的制裁以推动芬太尼帮助
item.description:
The Biden administration on Thursday removed the Chinese Ministry of Public Security's Institute of Forensic Science from a trade sanction list, part of a bid to convince Beijing to do more to halt the flow of the synthetic opioid fentanyl into the United States.翻译:拜登政府周四将中国公安部法医学研究所从贸易制裁名单中删除，此举是为了说服北京采取更多措施阻止合成阿片类药物芬太尼流入美国。

Washington put the institute on the list in 2020 over alleged abuses against Uyghurs and other minority groups, effectively barring it from receiving most goods from U.S. suppliers.翻译:华盛顿因涉嫌虐待维吾尔族和其他少数群体而于 2020 年将该研究所列入名单，实际上禁止该研究所接收来自美国供应商的大部分商品。

Former Chinese ambassador to the U.S. Qin Gang last year described it as "shocking" that the U.S., which had expressed frustration over Beijing's lack of cooperation on fentanyl, would sanction an institute he described as essential to controlling the drug.翻译:中国前驻美国大使秦刚去年表示，美国对北京在芬太尼问题上缺乏合作表示失望，却对一个他认为对控制芬太尼至关重要的机构实施制裁，这“令人震惊”。

The Chinese embassy in Washington did not immediately respond to a request for comment.翻译:中国驻华盛顿大使馆没有立即回应置评请求。

Reuters had previously reported the institute would be removed as Biden sought more cooperation from Beijing on fentanyl in a meeting with China's President Xi Jinping on Wednesday in San Francisco at the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) forum.翻译:路透社此前曾报道称，由于拜登周三在旧金山亚太经合组织(APEC)论坛上与中国国家主席习近平会面，寻求在芬太尼问题上与北京方面进行更多合作，该研究所将被撤销。

As part of the meeting, the men agreed to create a working group on counter-narcotics cooperation. The White House's National Security Council did not respond to a request for comment on what, beyond creating the working group, China pledged to do to stem shipments of the deadly narcotic.翻译:作为会议的一部分，双方同意成立一个禁毒合作工作组。白宫国家安全委员会没有回应记者的置评请求，即除了成立工作组之外，中国还承诺采取哪些行动来阻止这种致命毒品的运输。

The move was criticized by human rights activists and Republicans, who accused the Biden administration of going soft on Beijing over its treatment of Uyghurs.翻译:此举遭到人权活动人士和共和党人的批评，他们指责拜登政府在北京对待维吾尔人的问题上态度软弱。

Rayhan Asat, a human rights lawyer of Uyghur heritage, said she recognized the pressing issue posed by fentanyl, but that the U.S. decision raised questions about U.S. commitment to addressing China's rights abuses.翻译:维吾尔族人权律师雷汉·阿萨特(Rayhan Asat)表示，她认识到芬太尼带来的紧迫问题，但美国的决定引发了人们对美国解决中国侵犯人权问题的承诺的质疑。

"The United States has a legal obligation, under federal law, to address atrocity crimes once they have been determined as such. The question then arises: should addressing one issue take precedence over addressing the genocide? Can't we address both?" she said.翻译:“根据联邦法律，一旦确定暴行罪，美国就有法律义务解决这些罪行。那么问题就出现了：解决一个问题是否应该优先于解决种族灭绝问题？我们不能同时解决这两个问题吗？”她说。

Blocking fentanyl "precursor" chemicals has been a priority for Washington as the rate of overdose deaths involving the drug more than tripled from 2016 through 2021, according to the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC).翻译:根据美国疾病控制与预防中心 (CDC) 的数据，从 2016 年到 2021 年，涉及芬太尼“前体”化学品的过量死亡率增加了两倍多，因此封锁芬太尼“前体”化学品一直是华盛顿的首要任务。

The removal, according to a notice posted in the Federal Register, came after a "removal proposal" was received and reviewed, the department said in the posting, by a committee composed of representatives of the departments of Commerce, State, Defense, Energy, and sometimes, the Treasury.翻译:根据《联邦公报》上发布的通知，该部门在收到并审查了“删除提案”后进行了删除，该委员会由商务部、国务院、国防部、能源部、有时，还有财政部。

item.title: 拜登在精心策划的峰会后称习近平为独裁者
item.description:
U.S. President Joe Biden said on Wednesday he had not changed his view that Chinese President Xi Jinping was effectively a dictator, a comment likely to land with a thud in Beijing after the two leaders held straightforward summit talks.翻译:美国总统乔·拜登周三表示，他没有改变对中国国家主席习近平实际上是独裁者的看法，在两国领导人举行直截了当的峰会会谈后，这一言论可能会在北京引起轰动。

Biden held a solo news conference after four hours of talks with Xi on the outskirts of San Francisco. At the end of the news conference, he was asked whether he still held the view that Xi was a dictator, something he said in June.翻译:拜登在旧金山郊区与习近平进行了四个小时的会谈后举行了单独的新闻发布会。在新闻发布会结束时，他被问到是否仍然认为习近平是独裁者，他在六月份曾说过这样的话。

"Look, he is. He's a dictator in the sense that he's a guy who runs a country that is a communist country that's based on a form of government totally different than ours," Biden said.翻译:“看，他是。从某种意义上说，他是一个独裁者，因为他统治着一个共产主义国家，而这个国家的政府形式与我们的政府完全不同，”拜登说。

In response, China's foreign ministry said it "strongly opposes" the remarks, without mentioning Biden by name.翻译:作为回应，中国外交部表示“强烈反对”上述言论，但没有提及拜登的名字。

"This statement is extremely wrong and irresponsible political manipulation," foreign ministry spokesperson Mao Ning told reporters on Thursday at a routine briefing.翻译:外交部发言人毛宁在周四的例行记者会上对记者说：“这种说法是极其错误的，是不负责任的政治操弄。”

"It should be pointed out that there will always be some people with ulterior motives who attempt to incite and damage U.S.-China relations, they are doomed to fail."翻译:需要指出的是，总会有一些别有用心的人企图煽动和破坏美中关系，他们注定不会得逞。”

Mao refused to specify the identity of "some people" in answer to a follow-up question.翻译:毛泽东在回答后续问题时拒绝具体说明“一些人”的身份。

Last March Xi clinched a third term as president when nearly 3,000 members of China's rubber-stamp parliament, the National People's Congress, voted unanimously for him in an election in which there was no other candidate.翻译:去年3月，习近平获得了国家主席的第三个任期，当时中国橡皮图章议会（全国人民代表大会）的近3000名议员在没有其他候选人的选举中一致投票支持他。

Xi is considered the most powerful Chinese leader since Mao Zedong, after a decade of consolidating power in policy-making and the military, and stifling media freedoms.翻译:习近平被认为是自毛泽东以来最强大的中国领导人， 十年来巩固了决策和军队的权力，并压制了媒体自由。

There was no immediate reaction from the Chinese delegation, which had come to the United States to attend the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation summit in San Francisco. Hundreds of critics of Beijing marched through the city's downtown around noon, chanting "free Tibet" and "free Hong Kong."

When Biden made a similar dictator reference in June, China called the remarks absurd and a provocation. But the spat did not prevent the two sides from holding extensive talks aimed at improving strained relations, which culminated in Wednesday's meeting.翻译:当拜登六月份发表类似的独裁者言论时，中国称其言论荒谬且是挑衅。但这场口角并没有阻止双方举行旨在改善紧张关系的广泛会谈，会谈在周三的会面中达到顶峰。

item.title: 欧盟冯德莱恩：中国峰会旨在实现公平竞争环境
item.description:
European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen said on Thursday that a key goal of the EU summit with China in Beijing in December was to achieve a level playing field in trade in light of market distortions.翻译:欧盟委员会主席乌尔苏拉·冯德莱恩周四表示，12月在北京举行的欧盟与中国峰会的一个关键目标是在市场扭曲的情况下实现公平的贸易竞争环境。

As one example, von der Leyen said Chinese overcapacity in the clean tech sector was set to worsen and be exported as its economy slowed down, worsening distortions in the EU market - which the bloc could not accept.翻译:冯德莱恩举例说，随着经济放缓，中国清洁技术领域的产能过剩将进一步恶化并出口，从而加剧欧盟市场的扭曲——这是欧盟无法接受的。

China's trade surplus with the EU was the highest in history last year, just below 400 billion euros ($434.96 billion), she said.翻译:她表示，去年中国对欧盟的贸易顺差创历史最高水平，略低于4000亿欧元（4349.6亿美元）。

"We do not accept distortion from the inside, we should not accept it from the outside either," she told a conference on China in Berlin, noting this was why the EU had launched an investigation into imports of Chinese electric vehicles.翻译:她在柏林举行的中国问题会议上表示：“我们不接受来自内部的扭曲，我们也不应该接受来自外部的扭曲。”她指出，这就是欧盟对中国电动汽车进口发起调查的原因。

"Europe is open for competition. Not for a race to the bottom."翻译:“欧洲对竞争持开放态度。而不是逐底竞争。”

Von der Leyen said, however, that as much as the EU would protect its interests, it would also seek to address disagreements with China through dialogue - for example at their Dec. 7-8 summit, which comes after U.S. President Joe Biden met this week with Chinese President Xi Jinping.翻译:不过，冯德莱恩表示，欧盟在保护自身利益的同时，也将寻求通过对话解决与中国的分歧，例如在美国总统乔·拜登会见特朗普之后举行的 12 月 7 日至 8 日峰会上。与中国国家主席习近平的一周。

"Our goal is to achieve a level playing field in our trade relationship with China," said the official, who has driven recent European efforts to "de-risk" from Asia's rising superpower.翻译:这位官员表示：“我们的目标是在与中国的贸易关系中实现公平的竞争环境。”他最近推动欧洲努力“降低”来自亚洲崛起超级大国的风险。

"We will go to China in good faith," said von der Leyen. "We will never be shy in raising our concerns. But we must leave space for a discussion on a more ambitious relationship that benefits both of sides."翻译:冯德莱恩表示：“我们将真诚地前往中国。” “我们永远不会羞于提出我们的担忧。但我们必须留出空间，讨论建立更雄心勃勃、对双方都有利的关系。”

Von der Leyen said she expected action from China to deal with the current imbalances.翻译:冯德莱恩表示，她预计中国将采取行动解决当前的失衡问题。

"The story of how we relate to China is not yet fully written. Nothing is predetermined, we have agency and China is capable of change."翻译:“我们与中国的关系还没有完全写好。没有什么是预先确定的，我们有代理权，中国有能力改变。”
